title.value: What does it mean to be a responsible AI practitioner: An ontology of roles and skills
title.justification: This is the title of the research paper provided by the user.
title.quote: What does it mean to be a responsible AI practitioner: An ontology of roles and skills

extractions.description: This paper examines the roles, responsibilities, and necessary skills of responsible AI practitioners or AI ethicists. By analyzing job postings and conducting expert interviews, the authors propose a competency framework outlining the different occupations in this emerging field, the required skills, qualifications, and interpersonal qualities.

type.justification: The paper collects and analyzes job postings and conducts expert interviews to derive its findings. This empirical approach focuses on gathering and analyzing data to inform the proposed competency framework.
type.quote: To address these gaps, we examine the following research questions... We address these questions by conducting a two-part qualitative study. We examined 79 job postings from March 2020 to March 2022 and conducted expert interviews with 14 practitioners who currently hold these roles in the industry.

name.justification: The paper focuses on examining the roles and skills of AI ethicists and responsible AI practitioners, which falls under the research field of Ethics in AI.
name.quote: The so-called responsible Artificial Intelligence (AI) practitioners or AI ethicists are generally tasked with interpreting and operationalizing best practices for ethical and safe design of AI systems.

name.justification: The paper discusses the importance of interdisciplinary teams and collaboration, elements central to the Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) field.
name.quote: They are 'driven by curiosity and passion towards' issues related to responsible AI development and are excited to engage with the product teams.

name.justification: Despite its focus on ethics, the paper addresses technical aspects including bias, safety, and explainability in AI systems, closely related to the field of Machine Learning.
name.quote: The ability to learn independently in a new domain and master complex code bases is also listed as one of the key skills.
